channel.title: India News, Latest News in India, Live News India, India Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: Get the latest breaking news from India on politics and current affairs.

image.title: India News, Latest News in India, Live News India, India Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Pro-Pak slogans heard on Tehri campus
item.description: The Uttarakhand government has sought to downplay the row over two instances of pro-Pakistan sloganeering reported on a college campus in Tehri district on Sunday and Tuesday respectively. A probe has been ordered.

item.title: Uttarakhand sets 14 departments for micro governance
item.description: Two days after allocating portfolios among 11 cabinet colleagues, chief minister Harish Rawat on Thursday created 14 new departments to encourage micro-governance.

item.title: Garbage piling up in touristy Almora
item.description: The picturesque town of Almora -- which attracts tourists with its breathtaking view of the Himalayas is facing a pressing problem -garbage overflowing in most of its parts that is not just spreading diseases but also robbing the town of its natural beauty.

item.title: AAP’s Uttarakhand unit to launch door-to-door campaign
item.description: Ahead of the Lok Sabha elections, the Uttarakhand unit of Aam Aadmi party (AAP) is all set to launch a door-to-door campaign called ‘Aam Aadmi ke ghar ghar chalo samasya jano aur samadhan karo’ which aims to reach out to people in the state and take up their grievances against government departments.

item.title: AAP candidate makes unique use of FB for poll campaigning
item.description: In an innovative use of social media for poll campaigning, Harish Chandra Arya, the AAP candidate from the Almora Lok Sabha seat, has posted an appeal on Facebook asking voters to send him items like computer, mobile phone, utensils and even a 'jhaadu' (broom, the party’s symbol) to fight the elections.

item.title: Kashmiri students charged with sedition, freed after controversy erupts
item.description: “We have not filed any complaint against our students in any of the police stations,” Prof Manzoor Ahmad, vice-chancellor of the university, said.

item.title: Lalu Prasad’s wife, daughter in RJD's first list of candidates
item.description: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s wife Rabri Devi and eldest daughter Misa Bharti figured in the first list of party candidates for Lok Sabha polls in Bihar released on Thursday.

item.title: Stalin moves Madras high court, says EC silent over his representation on AIADMK symbol issue
item.description: Stalin filed a writ petition in the Madras high court flaying the Election Commission’s silence on his representation against AIADMK party symbols and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa’s photos being printed on small buses and Amma drinking water bottles.

item.title: Congress hails Kejriwal for exposing Modi’s development ‘myth’ in Gujarat
item.description: Congress today hailed Kejriwal's tour of Gujarat contending that there is another voice in the country exposing the "deficiencies" and development "myth" of Modi.

item.title: Indian Navy suffering due to govt apathy
item.description: With the Indian Navy’s image nose diving to an all-time low after the string of accidents that culminated in the resignation of Naval chief Admiral D K Joshi last week, the morale of the forces has hit rock bottom.

item.title: AAP vs BJP: Manish Sisodia’s car ‘attacked’ in Gujarat
item.description: A car carrying Manish Sisodia was attacked by unidentified men in Sabarkantha district of Gujarat today, the party claimed the attackers were BJP workers.

item.title: India aims to create 20 lakh industry-ready biotech manpower by 2020
item.description: Seeking to establish India as a world class bio-manufacturing hub, the Union science ministry in its new draft policy document has pitched for setting up strong research infrastructure and creating 2 million "industry ready biotechnology manpower" in the country by 2020.

item.title: Sushma Swaraj opposes Reddy brothers rejoining BJP
item.description: Senior BJP leader Sushma Swaraj on Thursday opposed the party’s proposed alliance with BSR Congress of which the ‘tainted’ mining barons, the Reddy brothers of Bellary, are a part and has written to the party president in this regard.

item.title: Centre seeks report from UP govt on Meerut incident
item.description: The Centre on Thursday sought a report from Uttar Pradesh government after 60 Kashmiri students studying in Meerut were booked for sedition for cheering Pakistan’s victory against India during the recent Asia Cup cricket match.

item.title: Tough task for state election commission in flood-affected areas
item.description: With Uttarakhand going to polls on May 7, the state election commission faces a big challenge to ensure that voting in areas affected by last year’s floods goes without a hitch and has embarked on a mammoth exercise for the same ahead of the Lok Sabha polls.

item.title: MLA defends wife seen in leopard-print coat, says it had 'fake spots'
item.description: The alleged leopard skin coat worn by a Congress MLA's wife during an assembly session had “fake spots” and was a 'Made in China’ product, the legislator claimed, and accused the woman who registered a complaint with the wildlife authorities of “conspiracy”.

item.title: Uttarakhand minister asks state govt to replace female secretary
item.description: Uttarakhand minister Harak Singh Rawat, who was accused in a molestation case in September last year, has landed in another controversy by reportedly asking the state government to replace a female secretary assigned to him with a male one.

item.title: Uttarakhand govt announces sops just as code of conduct sets in
item.description: Just hours after the model code of conduct came into force, the Uttarakhand cabinet on Wednesday announced a series of sops, including waiving off surcharge of Rs 4.26 crore leveled against entrepreneurs on their pending electricity dues.

item.title: Uttarakhand medical fraternity comes out in support of Kanpur doctors
item.description: The ongoing Kanpur doctors’ strike got an unequivocal support from the medical fraternity in Uttarakhand with thousands of government and private doctors and around 3000 medical students holding demonstrations and candle marches in all 13 districts of the state on Wednesday.

item.title: China’s expanding rail network in Tibet nears Sikkim
item.description: China has built extensive network of transport infrastructure in Tibet raising concern in India as it provided advantage to Beijing to move its troops to the borders fast.

item.title: Jaya flays PM on TN fishermen issue
item.description: CM Jayalalithaa today slammed PM Manmohan Singh for his hand shake with President Mahinda Rajapakse in Myanmar instead of a 'stern' message to stop the continuing arrests of Indian fishermen.

item.title: RSS people killed Mahatma Gandhi: Rahul Gandhi
item.description: Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi on Thursday took on RSS, blaming the outfit for assassination of Mahatma Gandhi.

item.title: Lok Sabha elections: Left parties snap ties with AIADMK
item.description: Unhappy over the AIADMK’s ‘unilateral’ decision to field candidates in all the 39 constituencies in Tamil Nadu and the lone seat in Pondicherry, the CPM and the CPI on Thursday decided to snap ties with the party and contest the Lok Sabha elections together.

item.title: Special train between Ahmedabad and Jammu Tawi
item.description: Western Railway will run special AC express train between Ahmedabad and Jammu Tawi from March 6 to March 28, 2014.

item.title: Lok Sabha elections: Vijayakanth’s DMDK begins talks with BJP
item.description: The move has dashed hopes of the DMK and the Congress, which were sending repeated feelers to the actor for the coming together.
